metadata.Title: CVE-2018-6253 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
NVIDIA GPU Display Driver contains a vulnerability in the DirectX andOpenGL Usermode drivers where a specially crafted pixel shader can causeinfinite recursion leading to denial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-6253` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libcuda1-375 - 384.130-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libcuda1-384 - 384.130-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
nvidia-375 - 384.130-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
nvidia-384 - 384.130-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
nvidia-libopencl1-375 - 384.130-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
nvidia-libopencl1-384 - 384.130-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
nvidia-opencl-icd-375 - 384.130-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
nvidia-opencl-icd-384 - 384.130-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required
